If you wish to join an existing alliance you must get an invitation from that alliance.

If you wish to join an existing alliance you must get an invitation from that alliance.

warning.buildingWorking.p: Anything this building is constructing will be destroyed if you initiate self-destruct on this building.

label.owner.value: You are the owner of this planet from:

label.battlegroundOwner.p: The longer you rule this planet, the less productive will the NPC factories become.

label.activateOverdrive.p: Overdrive this building to make it extract {0} times more resources while using {1} times more energy.

label.deactivateOverdrive.p: This building is currently overdriven. It is extracting {0} times more resources and using {1} times more energy. Deactivate overdrive to return it to its normal state.

warning.deployCancel.value: You will not get your deployed unit back

notYourPlanet.value: This planet does not belong to you!

label.planetHasEnemies.p: You can not claim this planet because it still has some enemy units or turrets left

label.noPlayerUnits.p: You can not claim this planet because you don't have any units in it

queueFull.value: Contruction queue full for this constructor

text.deactivated.p: Buildings do not use energy while inactive. Activate this building to resume its operations. If it is upgrading it will activate itself upon completion.

NpcMetalExtractor.about.p: These alien technology driven foundries have been abandoned long time ago by their true owners. By now only hollow shell remains. However be cautious because the guardians are still there.

NpcZetiumExtractor.about.p: These buildings were used for extracting and storing zetium. They are mainly inactive now. However their defenses are still strong. Caution is advised.

NpcGeothermalPlant.about.p: Built ages ago these buildings were probably meant as collectors for geothermal heat that is hidden below them. Defeat guardians of this place and use that power for yourself!

NpcSolarPlant.about.p: Solar power is converted in these buildings. Our scans indicate strong energy output and multiple hostile units there. Act with caution.

NpcCommunicationsHub.about.p: These structures look like some kind of communication device. Perhaps they were used to bring messages to other worlds?

NpcTemple.about.p: Whilst extremely advanced Precursors were also a deeply religious race. They gathered in this building to pray to their gods. The land on which it is standing is sacred and heavily guarded.

NpcExcavationSite.about.p: It seems like a dig site. Although nobody knows what they were searching for it is still guarded by hostile units.

NpcResearchCenter.about.p: It seems that this is a Precursor research laboratory. No one knows what is inside only that outside of it is guarded by swarms of robots.

NpcJumpgate.about.p: These jumpgates were used to warp forces between planets crossing solar systems in mere seconds. Even if they do not function anymore there is still great defenses set up to forbid strangers from entering its vicinity.

Mothership.about.p: The Mothership is the core ship for humans who inhabit this planet. They came here in this ship and used it as their first base securing perimeter around with deadly base defense towers.
Each Mothership has a basic MEX and some solar cells integrated in it and can provide a colony with core metal and energy needs.

MEX.common.p: Each MEX can be upgraded to increase it's effectiveness and extract more metal. However by doing so it also requires more energy to operate.
MEXes will shut down if you do not have energy to run them.
Each upgrade level increases metal extraction rate.

MetalExtractor.about.p: Built on ore mountains they are used to extract metal from dirt and rumble. Metal Extractors (MEXes) are facilities that provide metal one require by eating up through mountains and bringing its ore supplies up to the surface.

MetalExtractorT2.common.p: Better, faster and more expensive version of [reference:MetalExtractor.name].

MetalStorage.about.p: As MEXes rip through the ore not all metal is used up immediately. Excess metal is stored in these giant structures. When the time comes it is released from these containers and used in construction of our fleets and buildings.

CollectorT1.common.p: These wind panels are used to provide basic needs of energy to all buildings and construction. They can be upgraded relatively easy and are cheap and cost effective to produce if you have enough space.

CollectorT1.about.p: Each upgrade level increases energy output.

CollectorT2.common.p: These solar collectors are used to provide massive amounts of energy to all buildings and construction. By using technology from alien [reference:NpcSolarPlant.name]s their massive panels generate a formidable amount of energy. Although their advanced designs allow upgrading them beyond the limits of their former versions they cost a lot more than simple [reference:Objects/CollectorT2].

CollectorT2.about.p: Each upgrade level increases energy output.

CollectorT3.common.p: Geothermal vents are as rarely found on the planets. However they are powerful and these hubs allow you to use that power. They are the most effective means of generating energy and gives best cost to performance ratio.

CollectorT3.about.p: Each upgrade level increases energy output.

EnergyStorage.about.p: These large batteries keep vast amounts of excess energy to be used later. Due to their massiveness most of the structure are buried underground thus giving sufficient protection from enemy attacks.
Each upgrade level increases energy storage.

Barracks.about.p: Finest men are trained here to do battle in our cause. They undergo best physical and mental training there are and are equipped by powerful combat suits and weapons to aid them in combat.

ResearchCenter.about.p: Greatest minds of each planet work here to bring technological advancements to our civilization. Do notice that even if these researches often require much resources and manpower to bring visions alive they are well proven to be worth the cost.
It is essential that you have at least one of these research centers or your opponents will eventually overtake you with their superior technology.
Each upgrade level increases number of available scientists.

ZetiumExtractor.common.p: Zetium extractors will shut down if you do not have energy to run them.
Each upgrade level increases zetium extraction rate.

ZetiumExtractorT2.common.p: Better, faster and more expensive version of [reference:ZetiumExtractor.name]. By using alien technologies these structures will provide your most advanced zetium needs.

ZetiumStorage.about.p: After extracting zetium crystals are melted and stored as liquid. This is the only form allowing for later reuse of the material, however it is highly unstable and even slightest distortion could leave nothing behind. Because of that when building these storages distance is kept from all other buildings.

Crane.about.p: These gigantic cranes are very helpful in raising new colonies. Their price is insignificant compared to their ability to have many orders. Using few of these cranes commander can fully build a new colony in a few days.

Market.common.p: Market allows you to trade with other players in this galaxy. Matter converters allow sending and receiving goods instantaneously, however galaxy market dealers will require a fee to list your offers on their networks.

Market.about.p: Each upgrade level decreases offer submission fee.

Radar.common.p: These massive buildings are used for deep space telemetry. As they drain energy from our generators they can see planets in our and other solar systems. Furthermore it even registers fleet movements in galaxy and solar systems giving us insight at what is happening in our neighborhood.

Radar.about.p: Each upgrade level increases distance it can see.

Housing.about.p: These living pods create living space needed for our troops and crews of our tanks and ships.
If you're out of living space you cannot support more units in your army.

Headquarters.about.p: Deployed from Mobile Deployable Headquarters it is the first outpost in a foreign colony. Provided with enough metal and energy for initial construction it is the seed from which a thriving colony grows.
Headquarters allow you to construct buildings.

Vulcan.about.p: Defensive stationary turret especially effective against lightly armored units. Equipped with 6 CX-60 high speed cannons it can shed through armies quickly dealing enormous damage.
Only capable of hitting ground units.

Screamer.about.p: Equipped with twin ROCKO-3 heavy rocket launchers this stationary turret is best retaliation against tanks and heavy units.
Only capable of hitting ground units.

Thunder.about.p: Firing plasma balls capable of reaching suborbital levels it is your best bet against enemy crafts and bombers. Its projectiles detonate upon impact dealing massive damage.
Only capable of hitting space units.

GroundFactory.about.p: A great technological advancement allowing us to build tanks and other advanced ground units.

SpaceFactory.about.p: From the humble [reference:Units/Crow.name] scout class vessel to the great [reference:Units/Rhyno.name] battleship - [reference:SpaceFactory.name] brings it all at your disposal.

HealingCenter.common.p: [reference:HealingCenter.name] is a complex of medical care facilities and technical repair factories. It allows you to repair your wounded infantry, tanks and spaceships back to their full potential.

HealingCenter.about.p: Each level reduces healing cost and cooldown.

DefensivePortal.common.p: When activated this portal allows you sending troops to other planets for defense. It also allows other units to travel to planet it is built on to aid in its defense.
Beware that it can only accept a fixed amount of volume from other planets. If you want bigger reinforcements you'll have to either upgrade the portal or build more of them.

DefensivePortal.about.p: Each level increases incoming teleportation volume.

GivesUnits.p: This building gives units to planet owner after each period of time.

NpcInfantryFactory.about.p: This ancient factory produces light units out of solar energy and silicone it synthesizes within it.

NpcTankFactory.about.p: Powerful and heavily armed machines are created in this laboratory.

NpcSpaceFactory.about.p: This underground facility constructs spacecraft which can be used for defense and galactic conquest.

NpcHall.about.p: Holding this buildings brings you and your alliance victory points. Collect enough of them and become the supreme ruler of this galaxy!

label.convertRate.value: You can trade {0} VIP creds for 1 cred

label.selectedConvert.value: {0} VIP creds selected, you would get {1 one[one cred] many[? creds]}

label.becomeVIP.p: Becoming a VIP grants you daily creds you can spend on anything you like.
Also you get more than you have paid for!

Credits.warning.becomeVIP:
Beware that you should spend all your daily creds.

Unspent creds are not transfered to other day. Next day is considered to be 24 hours after your VIP has started.

tooltip.nextVipTick.p: Time when your current VIP creds will be reset to their maximum number

label.credsTooltip.p: Creds received from quest rewards cannot be used in market.

label.movePrice.p: It would cost you {0} creds to move this building.

Credits.label.boostCost: It would cost you {0 one[cred] many[? creds]}.

Not enough creds.
You need {0} more

description.noResearchCenter.p: You could explore this object if you had a research center in this planet.

description.explorationUnderway.p: You are currently exploring an object. Wait for the expedition to finish their job.

description.startExploration.p: You can send a group of scientists to explore this object.
You can discover resources and units while exploring objects. If you explore bigger objects there is a bigger chance that you will get something worthy of your time.

Exploration.description.instantFinishCost: It will cost you {0} creds to instantly finish exploring.

Terraform.message.foliageRemovalCost: You can remove this object for {0} creds.
Terraform.message.foliageRemovalConfirmation: Removal of this object will cost you {0} creds. Are you sure?

label.deadStar.p: This star is dead. A civilization once lived here but now it's long gone.

Galaxy.label.shield:
This solar system is shielded for
{0}

message.noRadar.value: You need a Radar to explore the galaxy

message.actionCanceled.p: Sorry. The action you have requested could not be performed. Please try again.

Tips.tip.0: Building energy generators on this land will grant you additional energy rate bonus.
Tips.tip.1: Building construction buildings on a flat land will increase their construction speed later.
Tips.tip.2: If you're not sure what building or unit does, click on Info icon to learn more.
Tips.tip.3: Don't build turrets on rocky ground! They will lose armor and perish in battle faster!
Tips.tip.4: Look for strong dark ground to build your turrets on. This ground gives them additional armor.
Tips.tip.5: You can zoom in and out using your mouse wheel or plus/minus signs in top-left map corner.
Tips.tip.6: When in battle units in your first flank have 70% chance of being hit while second flank has only 30%. Keep your important units in second flank.
Tips.tip.7: You can click blue arrows in unit construction window to skim through available units quickly.
Tips.tip.8: Occupy planets in battlegrounds and pulsars to get reinforcements, victory points and creds.

message.locationNotAvailable.p: You can no longer view this location

tooltip.units.value: Your moving fleets / Alliances moving fleets

message.combatCooldownInfo.value: Upon arrival there will be {0} cooldown before combat will ensue.

message.speedUpCost.value: Speed up cost: {0 one[one cred] many[? creds]}.

description.avoidNpc.p: Checked: Your fleet will try to avoid any battles with NPC spaceships. This will result in longer travel time if there are NPC units in your way.
Not checked: Your fleet will take the shortest route to its destination. It will engage any NPC ships that are on its way.

message.combatLog.p: Battle in {0 planet[Planet] galaxy[Galaxy] ss[Solar System] battleground[]} {1}{0 planet[, Owner] galaxy[] ss[] battleground[]} {2}

label.planetAnnexed.selfLose.p: You have lost a battle for your planet '{0}'. You no longer control it.

label.planetAnnexed.allyLose.p: Your ally have lost a battle for his planet '{0}'. He does not control it anymore.

label.planetAnnexed.emptyWin.p: Your units have arrived to unclaimed planet '{0}'. You can claim this planet if you want.

label.planetAnnexed.claimPlanet.value: You can now claim this planet for yourself.

label.planetProtected.explained.p: While this protection is active there will be no battles in this planet.

label.planetProtected.enemies.p: In a battle over a planet the owner of a planet lost. However, due to interstellar treaties his/hers last planet has been placed under protection for {0} (until {1}).

label.planetProtected.yours.p: Your last planet was under attack and you have lost. Due to interstellar treaties your planet has been placed under protection for {0} until {1}.

label.planetProtected.ally.p: Your alliance members last planet was under attack and you have lost. Due to interstellar treaties his/hers planet has been placed under protection for {0} until {1}.

content.allianceJoined.p: Please give him or her a warm welcome!

message.convertCreds.p: Are you sure you want to convert {0 one[one VIP cred] many[? VIP creds]} to {1 one[one cred] many[? creds]}?

message.cancelUnitTraining.value: Are you sure you want to cancel training of this unit?

message.cancelUpgrade.value: Are you sure you want to cancel upgrade of this building?

message.cancelConstructor.value: Are you sure you want to cancel construction of this building?

message.cancelOffer.p: Do you realy want to cancel your offer?

message.buyOffer.p: Do you realy want to buy from this offer?

message.createOffer.p: Do you realy want to create that offer?

message.dailyBonus.p: Come back every day and get your daily bonus!

message.stopFleet.value: Do you realy want to stop your fleet?

message.selfDestruct.p: You are about to initiate self-destruct for:

message.dismissUnits.p: You are about to dismiss your units.
You won't be able to undo this action.

message.renameAlliance.p: You are about to rename your alliance to '{0}'.
It will cost you {1 one[one cred] many[? creds]}.

message.leaveAlly.p: If you leave this alliance you won't be able to join other or create your alliance for {0}.

message.leaveSelfAlly.p: If you'll leave your alliance it will be dismissed.

message.kick.p: You are about to kick "{0}" from your alliance.

message.moveBuilding.p: It will cost you {0 one[one cred] many[? creds]} to move this building.

message.loginFailed.p: Server failed to authorize you. Please relogin in the main page and try again.

lookIntoForum.p: Also - please check out our forum, there might be some useful information regarding this issue there.

message.noConnection.p: No connection to server. Click '{0}' to reestablish it.

message.disconnect.default.p: You have been disconnected from the server! Click '{0}' to reconnect.

message.disconnect.serverError.p: Server has encountered an error. You have been disconnected! Click '{0}' to reconnect.

message.disconnect.otherLogin.p: Other game client connected as you. If this wasn't you (e.g. from other browser) and you didn't report any bugs recently (it can be game administrator, check your bug report), we advise to change your password IMMEDIATELY to ensure account safety.

message.disconnect.playerErased.p: Your account has been erased. We'll miss you.
Don't bother pressing '{0}'. It won't work.

message.disconnect.jsonError.p: Message from server was not understood. Please reload your client. If this behaviour repeat itself report us a bug describing what you are doing that causes this error. Thank you.

crash.p: Save yourselves! Mighty Space Bugs have infested our game client and sadly it is not Space Bug Resistant! (yet) Oh well, don't worry, you can always just press Refresh button on your browser and everything will be fine (probably).

message.log.general.p: This is an in-game log of your actions. Paste this to a file and attach it to your forum post describing your problems and it will help us to solve it.

message.clientCrash.general.p: However! If you want to prevent those pesky Space Bugs from infesting our client ever again you could send bits and pieces of nifty information we have collected. We assure you we WILL use that to improve our Bug-No-More formula (TM) more effective to make your gaming experience as pleasurable as humanly possible ;)

So just copy that text below to clipboard (or press our conveniently placed '[reference:label.clientCrash.copy]' button) and wander to our forum to report this bug. Your hard work will be rewarded. We promise. Cosmic pinky swear. Oh yeah...

message.clientCrash.debugPlayer.p: We could fix this however unfortunately you do not have debugger version of Flash Player so we can't collect much useful information. If you DO WANT to prevent this from happening ever again then click the '[reference:label.clientCrash.wiki]' button to get more information on how you can help us ;) We appreciate your help!

label.populationIncrease.value: These units will increase your population by {0}.

warning.wontFit.p: You will lose {0} if you claim reward to this planet due to insufficient storage.

warning.cantClaimReward.value: You cant claim this reward due to insufficient population.

message.rewardClaimed.value: Reward has been claimed to planet {0}

about.1.p: We have landed in this planet in our [reference:Buildings/Mothership.name] and it seems we are not alone. We have set up our defenses but they are draining more energy than our generators can create. This cannot continue for long!
You must build a [reference:Buildings/CollectorT1.name] to fulfill our energy needs. Do not waste time. Do it now!
To enter your planet select it from selector in top-left corner and start building immediately.

about.2.p: I see you did well, Commander.
Our energy levels are now normal. However it seems we are stuck here. At least for now.
The good thing is that we have spotted nearby ore deposits. We should build a [reference:Buildings/MetalExtractor.name] to draw metal from one of those deposits.
Our future rests in your hands, Commander.

about.3.p: It seems that our extractors are working properly. However we need more resources to keep our growth steady. Build two more resource extractors and they will be put to good use.

about.22.p: Our scouts located interesting object nearby. It seems to be remains of some giant animal. Unfortunately only bones are left now and even those are half buried.
Still it would be best if you would send team of explorers to check it out. Perhaps they can find something useful there.

about.23.p: Remember that research expedition you sent out recently? They are back and they brought an alien robot with them! Of course it's a bit damaged but our scientists have managed to turn it on. He is now a loyal servant! Isn't that wonderful news?

Oh, that research team also brought back some resources with them. Perhaps it would be wise to continue our exploration of that site? You never know what you might find there... It could prove very useful.

about.4.p: It is good to see you, Commander.
Our resource production is steady now. As wonderful as it is I cannot get it out of my head that we aren't pushing to the limits of our capabilities. There is so much raw metal and energy out there!
Call me greedy if you want, but I suggest we should upgrade our extractors. Surplus resources never hurt anyone, did they?

about.5.p: I see you have listened to my advice and upgraded our resource extractors. Do not stop here and invest even more into them. It will be rewarded in time.

about.6.p: Our scouts report hearing strange noises in the wind and our scanners are reading strange anomalies. I fear we are not alone. Our defence perimeter may not be sufficient for keeping whatever is out there out of the base.
We need troops. Order construction of [reference:Buildings/Barracks.name] now.
Our people need to feel safe.

about.7.p: Construction of your [reference:Buildings/Barracks.name] is complete as you ordered. A few men have volunteered to become our first Troopers but their numbers are low. They will not save us if someone attacks.
We need to have trained personnel that is able to defend us. Order training of Troopers in our [reference:Buildings/Barracks.name].

StrenghteningForces.about.p: I watch as you grow fierce and strong. But you must not stop here. You must go on. Increase our army strength. Make your enemies tremble in fear!

about.8.p: We have a problem. Our metal needs are growing and those two MetalExtractors won't keep us running for long. We need to claim another ore site.
Fortunately our scouts located one nearby our base. Unfortunately it is guarded by robotic alien creatures. I think we will not be able to avoid combat. As I was told they guard it with their lives.

We must act. Intelligence estimates that 12 Troopers will be able to take down the guards. It may take less or more depending on your strategic skills. But we have to take that ore site over. It is crucial to our survival.

about.32.p: We have claimed that ore site! We are free to build and upgrade a [reference:Buildings/MetalExtractor.name] there. I suggest you do it now. Those resources will surely be used by our people.

about.9.p: Commander, it is nice to see you!

Now that we are up and running with our metal production we can continue to increase its gains. Our scientists claim they can upgrade our metal extraction rates to numbers we never saw before! And I believe them.
Lets upgrade one of our MetalExtractors and see if they can deliver what they promised.

about.10.p: Folks at our science department say they found a way to boost our energy production levels! They just need a little investment, thats all.
Lets give them those resources and I am sure we will get a lot more back than we gave. Order upgrading one of Wind panels now!

about.116.p: In your last mission, "[reference:title.8]" you were rewarded with some creds. Go and take your reward if you haven't done so already.

Creds are a useful and powerful tool. They can be spent on various tasks like accelerating your constructions, researches and unit training. They can even be used for moving buildings or speeding up fleets!

And how do you get more creds? You can buy them from our shop which is accessible from N44 menu in bottom-left corner. You can also gain them by conquering and holding special battleground planets about which you will learn later.
And you can become a VIP. Becoming a VIP gives you more creds than you spend on the VIP service and allows you to use them daily as you see fit.
So go, order your first VIP and be rewarded greatly!

title.117.value: Could you work a little faster?

about.117.p: Congratulations on becoming a VIP, Commander.
As of now you have a daily number of creds to spend so why not spend some on something that is really useful?
I suggest we accelerate construction of any builing. That [reference:Buildings/ResearchCenter.name] that needs to be built seems like a good option.

about.11.p: Our colony is prospering. We have steady resource income, our troops are strong and fearless, our people feel safe and last but not least - the weather is nice. It's almost like I can call this place home.

There is only one tiny problem. We must progress forward and having a [reference:Buildings/ResearchCenter.name] would be a great plus. We already have a group of our colonists that would apply to work there.
I highly recommend you order building of a [reference:Buildings/ResearchCenter.name] in this planet. After all, one or two tricks from the science fun bag won't hurt us, will it?

about.24.p: Now that we have a [reference:Buildings/ResearchCenter.name] a lot more scientists are eager to explore. Our scouts have discovered other interesting objects in this planet and we have people burning to go there.
I suggest we try exploring those objects. I am certain there is more to discover.

about.25.p: Bringing a bunch of those alien robots really made the crowd crazy in our, ehrm, excuse me, jar-head lab. They demand they mount an even bigger expedition to another object. They say they found some references that they might find one of these [reference:Units/Glancer.name] robots down there. And that would certainly prove useful to us.
I say let them go. Order an exploration mission.

about.26.p: They are out of their minds!
Our scientists want to mount yet another expedition. To the huge mountain out there. However it requires a lot of personnel and we probably don't have enough right now.

We need to upgrade our [reference:Buildings/ResearchCenter.name]. Beware that while upgrading you won't be able to research any technologies. However you will still be able to send exploration missions.
It is up to you, Commander.

about.12.p: Now that we have a [reference:Buildings/ResearchCenter.name] we should think about investing to our military power. Go to your [reference:Buildings/ResearchCenter.name] and order research on [reference:Technologies/Seeker.name]. These advanced warriors are very useful destroying lightly armored enemy troops. They will help us greatly in battles against alien robots.
After researching that technology I suggest we should build at least several of these great warriors.

about.13.p: You have already lead quite a few battles yourself. And I see your progress. Perhaps you have noticed that few of our men also have improved their combat skills greatly. They are more effective in battlefield and can withstand more enemy fire if necessary.
I suggest we preserve these skilled warriors and hope we can train more. Do not let them die. These are great warriors. We need them alive.

ThirstForKnowledge.about.p: Important discoveries awaits us! Our enemies may build more fleets but we will build better ones! Invest into our research and see that it is worth its price.

about.118.p: In different times we need different things and it's not always easy to plan ahead. Research a market so that we could trade with other inhabitants of this galaxy.
Afterall they might be in need of something we have surplus and vice verca. Why shouldn't we help each other? We could even make a friend or two in this way.

about.27.p: Our scouts have detected a strange building guarded by alien robots. They managed to take some samples of the material lying around it and our researchers were working on them for quite some time.
It seems that this building is full of zetium, a new crystal material. Looks like it is very useful and can be used in many ways, even interstellar space travel. We need those crystals!
Go and destroy that building so we could claim them for ourselves.

EchoesOfBattle.about.p: There is much unrest in this galaxy. We are peaceful people but others are not so willing to share this peaceful bliss of mind. We must defend ourselves from their brutal ways and what is the best defense than preemptive first strike?
And don't forget about those aliens out there too...

about.14.p: Our scientists have received zetium examples gathered by our scouts. They say that it is a very powerful and useful material and wish to begin research of practical application of this new material.
Hurry! Go to your [reference:Buildings/ResearchCenter.name] and order research now.

about.15.p: Our research on [reference:Technologies/ZetiumExtraction.name] has payed of. We are now able to build much needed buildings that will extract precious zetium from these crystals.

about.121.p: We need more space for our people. Soon enough we won't have any rooms left.
Commence building of living pods immediately!

about.16.p: As a great leader you have brought us many victories. All your efforts are appreciated.

about.29.p: All our neighbors know about your skills. You are truly worthy. Keep it up!

about.30.p: You are truly a great leader. Your people thrive and prosper under your ruling.
I Wish best luck in your future affairs, Commander.

about.33.p: You are known in whole sector of this galaxy. Our allies respect you and our enemies fear you.

about.64.p: You are a leader in economy, science and war. Keep this on!

about.17.p: Now that we have a sufficient income for all three resource types we need to be sure they are not wasted. We need to build some additional storages to store excess resources we are not using at the moment.
Order construction of buildings that store each resource type, Commander.

about.18.p: Our scientists have found a way to use zetium in space travel! This is a glorious day! Order them to start researching of [reference:Technologies/SpaceFactory.name] now.

about.19.p: Now that we have [reference:Technologies/SpaceFactory.name] technology we must build a [reference:Buildings/SpaceFactory.name] on this planet.
I suggest you construct on that gray leveled building ground - it looks like building on such terrain will save us a lot of time.

about.31.p: We have built our [reference:Buildings/SpaceFactory.name]. Now we need ships to travel space. Unfortunately we cannot rely only on our [reference:Units/Mule.name] class transporter ships. They are strongly armored however without any offensive power they will be ripped apart in seconds by alien ships hovering planets and other objects in our solar system.
We need combat ships to counter them. Go to your [reference:Buildings/SpaceFactory.name] and order construction now.

about.119.p: Good job on building those crows. They are fast and deadly. I'm so proud about them. Lets put them to a good use, shall we?

There are some alien dirac ships hovering nearby planet. I suggest we take our fleet and wipe them out. That planet looks like a nice expansion spot and I wouldn't want any alien scum flying around there.

about.120.p: Good job on cleaning up those diracs, Commander!
We sure showed them! Anyway, back to bussiness. Its an awful mess down there after that battle - we've got wreckages flying everywhere. We should clean it up.
Why the frowned face? Oh, I must have forgot to mention that those wreckages can be used as resources in our worlds. Heh, I see you're smiling already.
Right on! Lets collect those resources! Build your first mule class ship!

about.35.p: As we have built our [reference:Buildings/SpaceFactory.name] we should train our pilots a bit! As an easy first task go pick on some Diracs.

about.36.p: Your recent activity in this region has made alien ships more cautious. Some rumors even tell they are planning a rebellion! Go and destroy their powerful [reference:Units/Thor.name] class ships. Show them who rules this galaxy!

about.37.p: It seems there is no stopping these alien ships. You must strike at their strongest spot to make them bow down to your might! It is the only way to stop the rebellion!

about.20.p: Now that we have mastered space travel we should start expanding to other planets. Our sensors indicate there is a nearby life supporting planet. However it is guarded by alien ships.
Use fleet you just built to annex that planet and take over its control.
To annex a planet we must land with our ships on its soil.

about.21.p: We now control two planets! We should start building immediately! Load your Mobile Deployable Headquarters into our [reference:Units/Mule.name] and travel to our new colony.
Deploy that [reference:Units/Mdh.name] to [reference:Buildings/Headquarters.name] and start constructing.
Oh, and I suggest we take as many resources as we can with that [reference:Units/Mule.name] to our new colony. They will prove to be very useful there.

about.34.p: We now have plenty of space in our new colony. After establishing an operational base we should begin exploring our galaxy.
Build a [reference:Buildings/Radar.name]. It will reveal a sector of galaxy map and show other solar systems with ship movement within that sector.

Keep in mind that running a [reference:Buildings/Radar.name] requires substantial amount of energy. It will drain your energy storage quickly if you do not have enough energy generated. And if it runs out of energy - it will simply shut down keeping you blind from enemy actions.

about.38.p: It is time to expand your empire. Gain another colony so we could thrive there! Make our ancestors proud.

about.39.p: Even if we have conquered that pesky world we should not stop with it. There is much ground to cover. Go and conquer yet another world. Make it fall to the might of our empire!

about.40.p: I am sure you are happy with our empire. But will you stop at this?

about.41.p: It is astonishing work you have done! But we need more ground to live on, our population is growing. You need to acquire more planets!

about.42.p: We have ultimate empire, all our puny neighbors are in fear. I say - lets take one more planet from them, just to show them our might. Shall we?

about.43.p: We should destroy some enemy transporters and corrupt their supplies. Hunt down some Mules and cripple their transport lines.

destroying_enemy_will.about.p: We have spotted nearby enemy activity. Destroy their fleet and troops to crush the resistance and show them our true power!

crushing_enemy_defenses.about.p: We cannot allow our enemies to reign for no more! Attack their planets and crush their defenses! Hurry!

about.65.p: We have enemies at our front lines! We must stop them! Go ahead and conquer one of their worlds. That will most certainly stop them from advancing on us.

allianceVictoryPoints.long.p: Victory points earned for alliance by its players.

message.battleground.p: Taking and holding planets in this solar system gives you Victory Points, Creds and Units.

message.planetRenamed.value: Your planet name has been changed to {0}.

tooltip.allianceFull.p: Kick existing players or upgrade your Alliances technology to invite this player.

buildCenters.p: Build or upgrade Research Centers to increase the number of your scientists.

notEnoughScientists.p: This technology needs {0 one[one scientist] many[? scientists]}. However only {1 one[one scientist] many[? scientists]} out of {2 one[one scientist] many[? scientists]} are available.

notEnoughScientistsExploration.p: You don't have enough scientists to explore this object.

warPointsNeeded.p: You need {0} war points to research this technology but you only have {1}.
You can get more war points by attacking NPCs or other players.

groupResearched.p: Another technology in this group has been already researched so you cannot research this technology

isGroup.p: If you research this technology you won't be able to research:

UnitTech.p: First level of unlocks this unit. Other levels upgrade it.

Zetium.common.p: Zetium is a rare crystal that has incredible properties. Combined with other technologies it allows for making of great buildings, ships and weapons. These crystals are also essential to our space engines and most other advanced technologies.

ZetiumExtraction.about.p: Allows building Zetium Extractors and Storages.

InfantryUpgradeTech.p: for ground soldiers built in [reference:Buildings/Barracks.name] like [reference:Units/Trooper.name] or [reference:Units/Seeker.name].

MetabolicChargers.about.p: Recent developments in armor technology allows embedding zetium shards into warrior armor thus making it more resistant to enemy hits.

HighVelocityCharges.about.p: Recent developments in zetium technology allowed infantry gun ammo to be upgraded with more explosive power. Zetium enhanced bullets and rockets reach greater velocity and bigger impact speed meaning more damage to enemy.

ShipUpgradeTech.p: for spaceships built in [reference:Buildings/SpaceFactory.name] like [reference:Units/Crow.name] or [reference:Units/Cyrix.name].
This technology DOES NOT improve [reference:Units/Rhyno.name] and [reference:Units/Mule.name] class ships.

ShipsArmor.about.p: This technology allows usage of zetium reinforced armor plates that are able to withstand more damage and keep ships alive in the battlefield for longer.

ShipsDamage.about.p: Introducing zetium into plasma particle stream greatly improves their power. Ionized zetium crystals expel intense heat that is enough to wade even through thickest armor.

TankUpgradeTech.p: for ground tanks built in [reference:Buildings/GroundFactory.name] like [reference:Units/Scorpion.name] or [reference:Units/Azure.name].

TanksDamage.about.p: Introducing highly unstable zetium into tank shells greatly improves their firepower and ensures that enemy units do not leave the battlefield alive.

TanksArmor.about.p: These shield generators generate point located shields that slow down incoming projectiles before impact. By minimizing their velocity they reduce damage dealt to hull of the tank.

FieryMelters.about.p: Using high pressure in metal extractors allows getting higher metal extraction and storage efficiency. Although this technology is a bit pricey it may be worth investing to if your metal needs are growing.
Each level increases metal extraction rate and storage.

SuperconductorTechnology.about.p: By using zetium coated wires our scientists are able to increase their throughput and use our energy more efficiently. This increases our energy generation rates and storage capacities. Investing in this technology may prove useful if you are falling short on energy.
Each level increases energy generation rate and storage.

PowderedZetium.about.p: These sharpened zetium cutters are used to get better quality raw zetium dust which can then be processed into high quality industrial grade zetium. It can be stored and used more efficiently thus bolstering our zetium raising needs.
Each level increases zetium generation rate and storage.

HeavyFlight.about.p: Employing gamma particles in our heavy engine inner processes allows us to reach higher velocities thus reducing time we need to make those little hops in solar systems and galaxies.
However this technology requires UX-20 engines which can only be found in our biggest ships. As it is they are also slowest, so this technology is very valuable for them.
Shortens flight times for [reference:Objects/Mule] and [reference:Objects/Rhyno] class ships.

UnitUpgrade.p: Each level increases unit armor and damage.

Trooper.about.p: Although they are our basic warriors they are a considerable force in numbers. This upgrade allows to further strengthen our main force by upgrading their weapons and armor.

Shocker.about.p: Enhances armor and rockets of already tough [reference:Units/Shocker.name] making them even more powerful in battle. Making them stronger helps them protect other units longer and their zetium enhanced rockets dishes out more damage.

Seeker.about.p: Upgrading weakly armored Seekers may give them a chance to lay that final winning shot upon your enemy. And even better - this technology even increases their damage by fitting them with zetium plated bullets.

Scorpion.about.p: Scorpion class vehicles can be fitted with better shield generators and faster particle accelerators. Investing into this research gives your basic unit advantage over same vehicles at your enemy side.

Azure.about.p: Mixing explosive materials in [reference:Units/Azure.name] rocket heads with zetium makes them more damaging and zetium also makes [reference:Units/Azure.name] hull more resistant to enemy shots.

Zeus.about.p: This technology increases velocity of tank projectiles thus increasing damage it does. It also thickens its armor so it could withstand more damage.

Crow.about.p: Upgrades [reference:Units/Crow.name] lasers and hull making it a better fighter that is cheap and cost effective to produce.

Cyrix.about.p: Fitting their lasers with high frequency zetium crystals improves [reference:Units/Cyrix.name] damage and shields. Researching this technology means your fleet can last longer and make more damage for same cost.

Rhyno.about.p: Upgrades already fearsome [reference:Units/Rhyno.name] Battlecruiser. This technology fortifies its armor with zetium plates making even harder to destroy and gives a formidable energy boost for its weapon systems making it the most fearsome ship in whole galaxy.

Dart.about.p: Improves longevity and damage for [reference:Units/Dart.name] class ships making them deadlier and allowing engaging enemies in fewer numbers.

Avenger.about.p: Upgrades [reference:Units/Avenger.name] making its rockets pass through more armor. Also upgrades its armor allowing to withstand more damage in unfortunate situation. Overall it makes [reference:Units/Avenger.name] class ships better interceptors.

Jumper.about.p: This research allows you to build Jumpers.

Alliances.about.p: Join forces with your neighbours. Protect each other. Coordinate your attacks. Help each other to complete quests. Anything is possible when you are not alone. So why wait? Create your alliance now!

tooltip.freeStorage.p: This ship has {0} units of storage available.

tooltip.buildInFlank1.p: Your units will appear in first flank.

tooltip.buildInFlank2.p: Your units will appear in second flank.

tooltip.maxPopulationReached.p: You have reached your maximum population. Your pods can harbor {1} people but only {2} is allowed in game.

tooltip.overPopulation.p: Your units and buildings will be {0}% weaker due to overpopulation.

title.emptyDefensivePool.p: Your defensive pool is empty. That means no units will be teleported to your defense in case this planet is attacked.
Build DefensivePortals in other planets or join an alliance which has DefensivePortals built to enable teleporting units from planets with DefensivePortals built.

title.possiblePool.value: When you are attacked you might get

tooltip.flank.p: Units in {0} flank has {1}% probability to be hit.

message.dismiss.value: If you dismiss selected units you will get:

tooltip.allHealable.p: Select all units in current tab for which you have resources to heal

label.willHeal.value: You can heal selected units for:

label.healCooldown.value: You wont be able to heal units again for {0}.

label.planetFull.p: You cannot unload {0} to this planet because {0} storage {1} full.

label.transporterFull.p: You cannot load resources to this transporter because it does not have any free storage space left.

label.planetEmpty.p: There are no resources in this planet to load.

label.empty.p: Transporter is empty and there is nothing to load in it's current location.

label.notYours.value: These units do not belong to you!

label.leavingSquadrons.p: These fleets are currently leaving this planet.

warning.noFleets.p: There are currently no ships leaving this planet.

label.cancelTraining.value: Upon training cancellation you will get:

message.notSelected.p: Some units were not selected because their volume exceeds maximum transporter storage.

message.noResources.p: Some units were not selected because there is no enough resources in this planet to heal them.

message.wasDeselected.p: Unit was deselected due to insufficient resources for healing.

Gnat.about.p: Weakest unit from alien ground army. They are pretty weak and vulnerable and their lasers do not do much damage. However they tend to be in large groups thus compensating their weakness with their quantities.

Glancer.about.p: Highly vulnerable but deadly to infantry. Their sniper rifles pierce through light armor. It is better to dispose of Glancers quickly however their tendency to hide behind other units makes them hard targets.

Spudder.about.p: Semi-heavy humanoid robots. Armed with homing plasma particles they are a considerable threat for your troops. They fire multiple particles at once making them excellent troops against groups of weak opponents.

Gnawer.about.p: Guardians of most sacred artifacts in alien buildings. They are fierce killing machines destined to annihilate anyone who trespasses their ground. Highly armored hulls make them hard to destroy and their massive cannons offer versatility against infantry or tanks.

Dirac.about.p: These fast vessels were built as quick attackers in assault fleets. However today they can only be found in small groups all over Nebula 44 lurking in one place and attacking anyone who approaches their vicinity - may it be friend or foe.

Thor.about.p: These highly armored but fairly weak ships were used as a front line live shields long time ago. However now they are mostly scattered alone or with small groups of Diracs whom they still protect.
If you get a grasp on few of these ships know that they are pretty useful in air to ground bombardment of your enemy ground forces.

Demosis.about.p: These gigantic ships wander around in Nebula 44. Once built for great conquest now their simple robotic minds wait for orders from masters who are long gone.
But beware of their massive armor and weapons. Their laser is slow and requires some time to recharge but packs a powerful punch that is able to take down whole ships in a few shots.

Trooper.about.p: Basic warriors of our armies armed with machine guns. They fearlessly run into battlefield bringing fear into our enemy hearts and confidence into our allies. Even if not very tough they can prove very useful in numbers.

Shocker.about.p: Highly armored field warriors with the capabilities to withstand enemy troop fire. Their rocket launchers are designed to counter more heavily armored opponents but massive shockers still work as best shields for your other anti-infantry units.

Seeker.about.p: Armed with [reference:InfoScreen/gun.sniper_rifle] they are lethal to lightly armored enemy units. Although deadly Seekers are very fragile and must be covered well behind the backs of other units or they will perish very quickly.

Scorpion.about.p: Scorpion class tanks are basic ground warfare vehicles. They pack a heavy punch with their [reference:InfoScreen/gun.cannon]. Scorpions are quite strong and armored and can take many enemy lives before giving up their own.

Azure.about.p: Azure hovertanks are best way of countering enemy tanks. Their twin rocket launchers on each side barrages battlefield with missiles devastating everything in their path. Hovertank technology stabilizes Azure while it's firing but makes it vulnerable to enemy shots so it should be shielded by other units.

Zeus.about.p: These massive tanks fortify themselves into the ground and shoot their projectiles into the space. They are designed to fight enemy spaceships and cannot target ground units.

Mdh.common.p: Mobile Deployable Headquarters (MDH) is used as first and primary base upon foreign colony. This massive vehicle deploys into a fully operational base with building construction capabilities, storage containers and even brings a small [reference:Buildings/MetalExtractor.name] and energy source.

Mdh.about.p: Beware! Although massive and big it is very fragile while undeployed. Do not let it get into battlefield or it will be damaged beyond repair very soon.

Mule.about.p: Slow and heavily armored transport unit. Its massive hull protects the cargo inside and allows deploying troops onto enemy battlefield even upon heavy fire.

Crow.about.p: Light, fast and versatile basic combat spaceship. Perfect for quick skirmishes and attacking lone enemy transporters.

Cyrix.about.p: Cyrix class battleships are standard combat ships used in our fleets. Their sturdy armor and formidable lasers vanquish our enemies whilst Cyrixes wade through space in their pride. Sometimes they are also used as shields for weaker ships like [reference:Dart.name] or [reference:Avenger.name].

Rhyno.about.p: Rhyno battlecruisers are flagships of any fleet. With their huge defences they can withstand massive fire and their array of weapons makes them strong against multiple types of enemies. However they are costly and their size makes them slow in travel.

Dart.about.p: Dart class ships were built specifically to counter [reference:Crow.name] and [reference:Avenger.name] class ships. They are fast and carry weapons deadly to those ships however they lack any solid protection from enemy fire.
They are best at hit and run attacks where they outnumber enemy to destroy them quickly and without casualties.

Avenger.about.p: Avengers are deadly against heavily armored ships. Their armor piercing rockets drill through and explode inside enemy ship hulls causing massive damage. Avenger fast engines ensure they can intercept [reference:Cyrix.name] and [reference:Rhyno.name] class ships easily and damage them severely.
However if Avengers are left in the battlefield they can suffer very quickly because they lack any kind of solid protection from enemy fire.

Jumper.about.p: Jumpers are lightning fast satellites that are used mainly for intelligence missions launched onto enemy planets. However because they were engineered for speed they lack any protection or guns and cannot sustain even lightest enemy fire.

MobileTurret.p: Can be transported in transporter ships. Does not shoot until deployed. Cannot be undeployed after deploying.

MobileVulcan.about.p: Mobile version of Vulcan defensive tower. [reference:MobileTurret]

MobileScreamer.about.p: Mobile version of Screamer defensive tower. [reference:MobileTurret]

MobileThunder.about.p: Mobile version of Thunder defensive tower. [reference:MobileTurret]

instructions.p: We have some urgent matters to attend to. Click introduction button to learn the game basics and lets get started.

warning.noMinResource.p: You don't have enough {0} for minimal offer.

label.onlyPlanet.value: Show orders from this planet only

tooltip.unitsDisabled.value: Units market is currently under development.

tooltip.notEnoughStorage.value: There are no enough storage for {0}

warning.doNotAfford.value: You do not afford this offer

warning.notFromPlanet.value: This is your offer but it has been submitted from another planet.

label.freeCreds.value: You can not use free creds in the market.
